Subjective: Trouble passing hard stools for 3 months. Infrequent bowel movements (3 days). Abdominal pain, cramps, and bloating. No blood in stool. No changes in eating habits. Underweight. Family history of bowel problems. ICE: Wants to know if it's serious or what it could be.
Objective: Abdomen: bloated, rounder than usual. Varying tympani on palpation. No pain on palpation. Normal bowel sounds. No urination issues. Regular periods.
Assessment: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). Ruled out: Ulcerative colitis, other serious conditions.
Plan: 1. Fibre sachets (Psyllium) daily for 6 weeks. 2. Drink plenty of water. 3. Follow-up in 6 weeks. 4. Safety net: contact if abdominal pain worsens, fever, or blood in stool.
